# navigationBar

**Instance Property**

The navigation bar managed by the navigation controller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var navigationBar: UINavigationBar { get }
```

## Discussion

It is permissible to customize the appearance of the navigation bar using the methods and properties of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationBar] class but you must never change its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/frame], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/bounds], or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/alpha] values or modify its view hierarchy directly. To show or hide the navigation bar, you should always do so through the navigation controller by changing its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationController/isNavigationBarHidden] property or calling the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationController/setNavigationBarHidden(_:animated:)] method.

## Configuring navigation bars

- **setNavigationBarHidden(_:animated:)**: Sets whether the navigation bar is hidden.
- **Customizing your app’s navigation bar**: Create custom titles, prompts, and buttons in your app’s navigation bar.
